intro: Epilobium perramosum, commonly known as the broad-leaved willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges. Epilobium perramosum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
